info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 6:28AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Laurens, southern Abbeville and Greenwood Counties through 715 AM EST... At 627 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Laurens to 9 miles west of Abbeville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Clinton, Ninety Six, Joanna, Cross Hill, Cokesbury, Waterloo, Hodges and Lake Greenwood State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
